properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 3:29AM MST until January 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boise ID
properties.description:
...SIGNIFICANT MOUNTAIN SNOW THIS WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...

.Snow will begin across east-central Oregon and the mountains of
west-central Idaho tonight as the first in a series of low
pressure systems impacts the region. The mountains will see
periods of heavy snow through Tuesday as three separate storm
systems track through the Pacific Northwest. Valley locations will
see periods of snow through Tuesday with accumulating snow
becoming more likely heading into early next week.

* WHAT...Snow expected. In the Western Magic Valley, total snow
accumulations of 1 to 3 inches mostly north of the Snake River.
In the Camas Prairie 4 to 8 inches. Wind gusts to 25 MPH will
cause blowing and drifting snow.

* WHERE...Western Magic Valley and Camas Prairie zones.

* WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY
